intro: Scrophularia attariae, commonly known as the Armenian figwort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy, often tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. The flowers, which are typically pink or purple, bloom in late spring to early summer and are adapted for pollination by insects.
